body_html:
Hi! I meet the same problem.
I'm using opencv3.1 tensorflow1.4 in ubuntu14.04. When I included tensorflow headers like #include <tensorflow/core/public/session.h> or #include "tensorflow/cc/ops/standard_ops.h", cv::imread can not read images encoded by JPEG, but can read other encoding images like Uncompressed 8-bit RGB. When I commented TF headers, I can read any images by cv::imread. Is there any solution? Thanks a lot!!! @martinwicke @aselle How can I configure OpenCV to use jpeg manually? I will try that.

body:
Hi! I meet the same problem.
I'm using opencv3.1 tensorflow1.4 in ubuntu14.04. When I included tensorflow headers like #include <tensorflow/core/public/session.h> or #include "tensorflow/cc/ops/standard_ops.h", cv::imread can not read images encoded by JPEG, but can read other encoding images like Uncompressed 8-bit RGB. When I commented TF headers, I can read any images by cv::imread. Is there any solution? Thanks a lot!!! @martinwicke @aselle  How can I configure OpenCV to use jpeg manually? I will try that.
